III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth alleged that they were punched in the face by a staff
member. Youth is not injured and does not require medical
attention.
Investigation Interviews:
Staff 1/ Complaint Source was interviewed face to face at the
facility on February 9, 2024. Staff 1 reported when she arrived at
the facility on February 8, 2024, Youth A came running up to her
reporting Staff 2 had punched him in the face. She reported she
never saw any marks or bruising on Youth A’s face but gave him an
ice pack. Youth A then began to start eating the ice and did not
complain about the pain. She reported when she arrived at the facility
Staff 3 was with Youth A, Staff 2 was in the cafeteria with Youth B
and the other youth was with another staff member in the game
room. Staff 1 reported Youth A did not complain about his face
hurting after the ice and she stated Youth A just kept stating Staff 2
needed to be fired. Staff 1 reported she has been working with Staff
2 for a while and has never seen any poor interactions between him
and the youth.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on February
9, 2024. Youth A reported he likes it at the facility and enjoys most of
the staff. He reported he does not like Staff 2 because he punched
him in the face yesterday. When asked to explain what happened,
Youth A reported he was having a hard morning, and he was sitting
crying in the hallway near his room. He reported when he stood up,
Staff 2 walked past him and punched him in the face. Youth A
reported Staff 2 used a closed fist and hit him below the eye. He
reported he does not know why that happened and believed Staff 2
should be fired. This consultant looked at the spot where Youth A
stated he was hurt and there was no mark or bruise. Youth A
reported there was no one else who witnessed this happening.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on February
12, 2024. Staff 2 reported he has been working at the facility for the
past 6 years. He reported that he is currently working on the third
shift. Staff 2 reported on the morning of February 8, 2024, Youth B
began to have escalating behaviors and was brought into the
2

cafeteria by Staff 3 to help calm down. He stated he was working
with Youth A that morning. Staff 2 reported Youth A had a toy that
would squirt water at people and he started to spray other youths
with the water. He reported he told Youth A he needed to stop, and
Youth A then sprayed Staff 2 with water. Youth A then went running
down the hallway and dropped the toy on the ground, Staff 2 picked
up the toy and put it in the office. Youth A got upset that the toy got
taken away and started to be assaultive towards Staff 2. Staff 2
reported a Staff 4 walked through the unit and Youth A attempted to
punch her. At that time Staff 2 had Staff 4 bring the other youth to the
game room. He stated Youth A started to kick, punch, and attempt to
bite Staff 2 multiple times. He reported he used approved blocking
techniques and never restrained Youth A. Staff 2 reported Youth A
stated he was going to get Staff 2 fired because he threw away his
toy. He reported Staff 3 switched out with him since Youth A was
targeting Staff 2 specifically. Staff 2 reported he never punched
Youth A in the face.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on February 9,
2024. Staff 3 reported when he came onto shift on February 8, 2024,
Youth B was having escalating behaviors. Staff 3 reported he
brought Youth B into the cafeteria to try to calm him down and not
disrupt the other youths who were getting ready for school. He
reported when in the cafeteria he heard Youth A yelling on the unit,
so Staff 3 opened the connecting door from the cafeteria to the unit.
Staff 3 reported he saw Youth A was physically attacking Staff 2 with
a closed fist and Staff 2 was using appropriately trained blocking
techniques with Youth A. He reported he then switched out with Staff
2 to go into the cafeteria and Staff 3 would work with Youth A. He
reported Youth A continued to swear and yell but was no longer
physically attaching anyone. Staff 3 reported when Staff 1 came onto
shift, he heard Youth A tell her that Staff 2 had punched him in the
face. Staff 3 reported he did not see any marks or bruises. He stated
from what he saw through the doorway, Staff 2 was doing everything
they were trained, and they switched out to support one another.
Staff 3 reported he has been working with Staff 2 for a couple of
hours in the mornings and never saw any concerning interactions
with the youth.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on February
9, 2024. Youth C reported he likes living at the facility but sometimes
the youth can have behavioral problems. He reported yesterday
before school he had to go into the game room because Youth A and
Youth B were having behavioral problems on the unit. Youth C
reported Youth A keeps saying Staff 2 needs to get fired because he
punched him. He reported Staff 2 is a good staff member and he has
never seen him ever hit a youth. He reported Youth A likes to make
up stories, so he does not get a consequence.
3

Documents Reviewed:
- Facility incident report dated 02/08/2024 completed by
Staff 1- Incident report was consistent with Staff 1’s interview.
- Facility incident report dated 02/08/2024 completed by
Staff 2- Incident report was consistent with Staff 2’s interview.
- Facility incident report dated 02/08/2024 completed by
Staff 3- Incident report was consistent with Staff 3’s interview.
- Developmental Adolescent Residential Treatment
Behavior Management Policy- Positive interventions
strategies should be used by staff to help assist the youth
develop improved problem solving, self- management, and
social skills.
- Developmental Adolescent Residential Treatment
Restraint Policy- Physical Management may only occur with
a youth whose behavior is significantly dangerous to self or
others. Physical Management is performed according to the
current techniques of the “Handle with Care”, DART’s
approved crisis intervention program. The use of force and
duration of restraint must be limited to that which is necessary
to ensure the optimal care, welfare, safety, and security of all.
Restraint techniques must never be used for punishment,
discipline, or retaliation. Prohibited Behavior Management
Techniques at the facility includes corporal or physical
punishment including spanking, hitting, pinching, slapping, or
hair pulling.
- Developmental Adolescent Residential Treatment
Discipline Policy- Facility prohibits all cruel and severe
discipline including any type of corporal punishment inflicted in
any manner.
- Staff 2’s Human Resource File- There were no disciplinary
reports or performance evaluations that reflected poorly
pertaining to Staff 2’s work with youth at the facility. Staff 2
was put on a performance improvement plan due to not
completing all his required trainings timely which was dated
December 2023. Training records were viewed and noted
Staff 2 completed his most recent behavior management/
restraint training on 11/30/2023.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance with the rule. There was no
evidence that Staff 2 punched Youth A. Staff 2 switched out with
Staff 3 as it was noted Youth A was physically targeting Staff 2
which is the protocol staff should follow at the facility.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
